description.narrative: By 2023, the government has increased capacity to legislate, plan and budget effectively on gender sensitive, multi-sector adolescent friendly services., which contributes to Access To Justice, Adolescent Empowerment, Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Learning Outcomes, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Sanitation. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2023, adolescents are learning, healthy, developing and participating in an environment free from violence, exploitation and abuse.

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF EDUCATION ARTS AND CULTURE

sector.narrative: Administrative data and Information Management System (IMS) including CPIMS+, GBVIMS+, MRMIMS+
Education Management Information System (EMIS) (excluding learning assessment systems)
Justice, law and order policy, planning and administration
Promoting diversion and alternatives to deprivation of liberty
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
System strengthening - early learning / pre-primary standards and governance
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education
Violence, exploitation, and abuse - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use
Water supply and sanitation - large systems

title.narrative: Namibia United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Policy on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF Procedure on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF procedure for programme implementation partnerships
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Namibia 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2023, the government has increased capacity to legislate, plan and budget effectively on gender sensitive, multi-sector adolescent friendly services.

description.narrative: The entry into force of the Child Care and Protection Act and the signature of the Basic Education Act signed in 2019 provide a solid basis for improved quality care, protection and inclusive learning outcomes. The Education Sector especially continues to implement key recommendations from the Public Expenditure Review of 2017, such as considering learner-targeted funding, and uses EMIS data to inform policy and budget decisions. The Government increasingly aims for quality disaggregated data to track and resolve inequities, including through EMIS and VACS. Teen clubs are currently promoted nationwide as a promising practice to strengthen adherence to HIV treatment. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:18/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of laws, policies and strategies specific to adolescents developed or revised to meet established standards
Existence of a strengthened system for adolescent participation
Availability of quality and timely data provided by national EMIS

target.value: 2023:15th school day report and Annual Education Census
